Painstaking on-board video shows the plane as a tribute to U.S. servicemen who have died in combat . Originally built in 1945, it was among scores of bombers rolled out during World War Two and later used in the Korean War .

The property, in the leafy south east London suburb of Chislehurst, was designed and built especially for government officials as the Cold War intensified in 1951 . The wooden area surrounding the building afforded it secrecy and the house was built with five foot thick concrete walls . It took two years to totally renovate the property as workers were forced to carve windows and doors out of the formidable concrete walls. The house also boasts a swimming pool in the atrium, a games room and outside roof terrace .

A hot air balloon collided with a transmission tower in Russia . The basket, carrying three people, plummets to the ground . Instructor and two passengers are in a stable condition in hospital .

But researchers note they are not quite sure if gaming makes people learn skills better - or if people who learn skills more likely to become gamers . The results showed gamers improved performance on both tasks, while non-gamers did what they expected .

The 5.45 acre estate in San Clemente, California, was bought by Nixon in 1969, six months into his presidency . It is made up of a 'grand pavilion' measuring 9,000 square feet, and boasts several satellite residences for staff . When Nixon resigned in shame in 1974, he sold it to political ally Gavin S. Herbert, founder of Allergan pharmaceuticals company . Nixon owned the home until 1980, when he bought it for $1.4million and moved out in 1980 .

Wood bison were North America’s largest land mammal, but the native Alaskan species disappeared from the state more than 100 years ago . They were imported from Canada to the Alaska Wildlife Conservation Center in 2008 but restoration of the threatened species was delayed . The state and federal governments agreed to consider the Alaska wood bison as 'experimental' without the usual Endangered Species Act requirements .

The government announced on Friday that the states and territories' treasurer had agreed to a 10 per cent GST tax . The move may affect consumers buying products for less than $1,000 online from overseas, thus affecting companies such as Google, Microsoft, Amazon and eBay . Consumer advocacy group Choice says tech-savvy Australian consumers might be able to avoid the tax by concealing their location through virtual private networks . Netflix customers would only have to pay an extra 90c while song downloaders would pay an additional $2.19 track on iTunes .

Manchester City are confident UEFA’s punishment for a breach of financial fairplay regulations will be lifted this summer . City have been limited to a net transfer spend of £49million in the last two transfer windows - they spent £25m bringing Wilfried Bony in from Swansea in January . Arsenal have paid more in transfer fees in the past 12 months than City who were traditionally Europe’s biggest spenders .

Men aged 65 and over ten times more likely to be diagnosed with malignant melanoma . In 1975 just 7.9 per 100,000 were diagnosed - a seven-fold increase . Getting sunburnt once every two years can triple a person’s risk of developing the disease .
Dave Tyler captured these stunning pictures showing the ferocious activity on the sun's surface during its solar maximum . The 72-year-old designed and built his own observatory in 1977 and now uses powerful telescopes to observe and photograph the solar system .
Time lapse footage speeds along the 9km long electrified track, which leads from Kleine Scheidegg to Jungraujoch and stands at an elevation of 2061m and 3454m respectively . Two people quickly cross the track in front of the train as it begins its descent of the mountain, passing close to a number of skiers . The train begins travelling even faster as the banks of snow rise up higher alongside it .
The monkey approaches a woman, who holds a banana, with its outstretched hands . The monkey takes a small bite before pulling it from its skin, which he leaves with the lady . When the lady leans forward, the monkey appears to sniff its food while diverting its eyes .

Vets say they know the cubs are red fox - among most common of species in America - because of their white tales .

Dikembe Mutombo was an eight-times NBA All-Star and a shot-blocking Congolese centre whose legendary finger-wagging motion became one of the most recognized gestures in the game . He played in the NBA from 1991 until 2009 and recorded 11,729 points, 12,359 rebounds, and 3,289 blocks during 18 seasons . The Class of 2015 will be enshrined at the Hall of Fame in Springfield, Massachusetts on September 11 .

Storm Prediction Center upgraded to its second-highest advisory level - a moderate risk - on Wednesday . It stressed that a significant tornado or two could form in a narrow stretch from northern Oklahoma to central Missouri . Fewer than 1 million people were in Wednesday's 'moderate risk' area between Wichita, Kansas, and Jefferson City, Missouri, but 34 million were under a slight risk of seeing damaging winds, large hail and possibly a tornado .
The banyan tree in Guangxi province does not stand on a single trunk, but a whole web of roots . Locals say they have watched the whole thing sway in the wind due to its flimsy structure . The original roots grew up against a wall, but when the wall was demolished the tree was uprooted to its new location .

The 100 tonne crane barge is being used to lift shopping trolleys and cars at the bottom of the River Avon in Bath . The Canal and River Trust in Bath are carrying out the dredging operation which was ordered after hundreds of objects were identified as blocking the river . Deutsche Bank survey shows Australians pay higher prices for a range of consumer goods and services than are paid in any other place . The survey uses the purchasing power parity index to determine the relative price levels to the US dollar . It found that Australian prices are at 112 per cent of the US, meaning that we pay $1.12 to every $US 1 .

The creatures were discovered at Blairgowrie Pier but are fast on the move to their proper migration . They migrate once a year in the Port Phillip Bay area in Southern Victoria, piling on top of each other to create a moving mound . The full migration is expected to occur in two to five weeks when the water temperature will drop to 14 degrees Celsius .

Crew scoured a burning home in Boise, Idaho, searching for people shouting 'Help!' and 'Fire!' Finally, to their surprise, they found a pair of squawking birds . Both were pulled from the home and given oxygen masks . Officials have yet to track down the birds' owners .
US YouTube user Elman511 cracked open an over-sized egg that was laid by one of his hens, writing: ‘The big egg has another normal egg in it!’ He then cracks the smaller egg, which also has a yolk and white inside . The unusual occurrence is down to a counter-peristalsis contraction . A hen is in the process of forming an egg in her oviduct and another oocyte – the ovum or egg cell that becomes the yolk of the egg – is released too soon .

Insurers are increasingly checking social media accounts following a break-in . This is because most insurers have a 'reasonable care' clause, meaning firms don't have to offer up cash if they prove people weren't careful with protecting their possessions . Police warn would-be thieves will check social networks to see whether property owners have said they will be away, before striking while nobody is home .

Professor John Warren discovered the tree displays 'unique flowering behaviour' The trees, which grow in tropical and Mediterranean climates, flower with their 'female parts' ready to be pollinated by bees . The flowers close for the night and then the next morning they reopen . But now they use their . 'male anthers' to spread their pollen .

As many as 1 in 8 will suffer injuries serious enough that they will need to miss at least seven training sessions or matches . These range from bruises and sprains to fractures, torn ligaments and at worst, concussion and damage to the brain and spinal cord . In New Zealand, sports authorities monitor the number of injuries compared to the population making it possible to work out how risky it is .
Researchers from CNRS-GATE and University of California analysed sexes . They found that male athletes are more driven by the desire to beat the competition than female athletes . The results suggest that while men enjoy competition in the office, women like to be rewarded for their own work, rather than that of a team .

The metal is the same as that used to make professional sports bikes but has been altered by Apple to make it lighter, according to reports . Apple is rumoured to be planning on using stronger materials to construct its next generation smartphone .

Some combat and multiplayer games tap into the body’s flight or fight response, causing adrenaline to surge through gamers’ bodies . While clicking violently may not qualify as a work out, gamers can get sweaty, and this can make their mouse slippery .

On Tuesday, SpaceX came incredibly close to landing its Falcon 9 rocket booster on a barge in the middle of the Atlantic . Now, leaked footage reveals just how close the attempt came to success, with a close-up view of the daring attempt shot . A deleted tweet by Musk says the rocket appeared to be suffering from 'stiction in the biprop throttle valve, resulting in control system phase lag' The video shows the rocket drifting onto its target before a gust of wind topples it over .

Suddenly he begins panic and while not entirely visible to the camera, a minor avalanche occurs behind him . Fire at Bradford City's Valley Parade stadium killed 56 people and injured 265 . Sir Oliver Popplewell's inquiry concluded that the cause was an accident probably started by a spectator dropping a cigarette into the rubbish accumulated under an old timber stand . Judge says police should look at eight other fires allegedly connected to the club's then chairman .
The fire at Bradford City's Valley Parade in 1985 claimed 56 lives . Former sports minister Gerry Sutcliffe says the fire was just one of at least nine fires at businesses owned by or associated with the club's then chairman Stafford Heginbotham . Martin Fletcher, who was 12 at the time and escaped with his life from the blaze but lost three generations of his life . The book 'Fifty-Six - The Story of the Bradford Fire' is contained in the book by Martin Faletcher .

Eerie phenomenon is called an 'earthflow' and is a rare type of landslide .

Pelicans are large water birds that have mainly light-coloured plumage - the exceptions being the brown and Peruvian pelicans . The ancient Tuscan settlement, 40 miles south east of Genoa, is shrouded in mystery with its origin and much of its history remaining unknown . A number of historical earthquakes, including one in 1887 that measured 6.7 on the Richter scale, caused severe damage to the settlement’s infrastructure . The town is considered to be the most famous abandoned location in Italy and folklore suggests that the area is haunted .

Tateyama Kurobe Alpine Route opened to the public on today and allows tourists to view the spectacular snow-walled passageway along the 1000ft section . The impressive route opened in 1971 and usually draws about a million visitors every year, although numbers have failed to reach that figure in last few years . Sights along the way include scenic landmarks such as Kurobe Dam, hot springs and the Hida Mountains .
Scientists found that the cracking is caused by the rapid formation of a gas-filled cavity within a slippery substance called synovial fluid that lubricates the space between the finger bones . The experiment was made possible by magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) and a study co-author's finger .

A rarely-seen Napoleonic fort will be joined to the mainland thanks to a 328ft footbridge across the sea . Known as St Catherine's Island, the fort can only be reached by crossing a beach during low tide . The new connector will open up the island from Tenby, Pembrokeshire, for the first time . It's expected to also include an on-site gift shop, security office and paths .

The cat cafe is based in Moscow and is the first of its kind to be opened in Russia . Customers are allowed to adopt the cats, should they strike up a rapport with a feline over a piece of cake, but only if they meet certain requirements . The fixtures and fittings are catered to the cats and feature scratching posts, hammocks and even feline-themed wallpaper . Toys are also available to the guests and one customer can be seen holding a feather dangler while interacting with animals .

Research led by a scientist at the New Jersey Institute of Technology has revealed the first high-resolution footage of a solar flux rope 'rope' taking shape on the sun . In the video, twisting groups of magnetic fields writhe around a central axis before bursting from the sun and the rope ultimately causes a bright flash to form . The insights were made using the 5.2ft (1.6 metres) New Solar Telescope at the Big Bear Solar Observatory in California .
The fireball was captured on camera on Sunday by the United Kingdom Meteor Observing Network (UKMON) in Portadown, County Armagh . Footage shows it glowing brightly as it races northwards towards the Irish Sea . Astronomers revealed that they believe a meteor that streaked across the sky above Chelyabinsk in Russia triggered the conversion of biblical figure Paul .
Audi has created 'green' diesel fuel made from water and carbon dioxide . The car maker claims it could provide a carbon neutral way of powering vehicles . Experts used renewable energy to convert the carbon dioxide and water into a form of crude oil known as 'blue crude', which was then refined into diesel . Tests have shown the fuel can be mixed with diesel from fossil fuels .
The revolutionary system is being commercialised by French company Pixium Vision . It uses a technique known as 'neuromodulation' in which electricity from a chip stimulates the nervous system to restore sight . A connected 'pocket processor' converts that recording into an infrared image, which the goggles will then beam into the eye . Second Sight, the company that got FDA approval two years ago, currently offers patients about 20/1300 vision .

In a video, the contraption is shown popping balloons and lighting matches . The gun is made from aluminium and shoots rounds of 1.4-watt Class 4 lasers . Nasa has been testing a flexible wing on a plane in California . The wing can bend from -2 degrees up to 30 degrees. It means that regular flaps aren't needed - and it is much lighter . Latest test of the technology took place above Nasa’s Armstrong Flight Research Center in Edwards . It could also increase fuel efficiency up to 12 per cent, and reduce noise at take-off and landing up to 40 per cent .

Stanford University team believe lab-engineered antibodies could eradicate not only primary tumours, but also distant metastases that have spread through the body . Samsung said its first quarter net profit plunged 39 percent as consumers switched to bigger iPhones, squeezing earnings from its mobile business to less than half what they were a year earlier . Apple held an 18.2 percent market share after selling 61.2 million iPhones . Figures were impacted by seasonal and other factors . In the fourth quarter, Apple and Samsung were virtually tied with around 20 percent of the market each .
Some owners of the Apple Watch have found that it malfunctions if worn on tattooed wrists . Some dark, vibrant ink seems to cause the watch’s heart rate monitor to lose connection and give inaccurate readings, according to tests . Apple Watch uses green LED lights paired with lightsensitive photodiodes to calculate the number of times the heart beats each minute - your heart rate . It is thought red and green ink reflect light in a similar way and the sensor can't distinguish between the blood and tattoo .
Bruno Smartcan is said to be the first internet connected kitchen bin and vacuum cleaner . It uses sensors to sense when dust and debris from the kitchen floor are swept towards it with a brush . The bin also has an integrated bag dispenser that additionally sends alerts to a smartphone when the owner is getting low on bags .
Adidas go is available on iOS only via the Apple App Store . It uses the phone's accelerometer to track the user's stride . The app will continue to track and adjust the songs accordingly . Songs are played in full but users can skip tracks if they want to . Instagram has launched a @music app to help people explore songs and albums .

It looks at the composition of Iron Man's suit, a gold-titanium alloy in one of the movies . The video also explains the science behind super-healing abilities . Tony Stark's original suit of armour would have weighed around 70kg (150lbs) The ACS said that suit would probably weigh around 160kg (350lbs)
Automated Planet Finder (APF) consists of a 2.4-metre automated telescope and enclosure, and a high-resolution spectrograph . It takes starlight from the telescope and spreads it into a rainbow of colours, splitting light into spectrum of thousands of wavelengths that can be measured with great precision . The ultimate goal of extrasolar planet research is to find planets like Earth that may support life .
Cassini was around 38,500 miles (62,000 km) from Hyperion when the image was taken almost a decade ago . The moon's porous surface can be seen in incredible detail in this image taken as it performed a flyby of the satellite . Scientists believe around 40 per cent of the moon is empty space .

Fossils from an extinct sperm whale that died 7 million years ago have shed new light on the evolution of modern day whales . The bones, which were discovered in Panama, indicate that the bone involved in sound generation and echolocation got smaller throughout the whale’s evolution . Although why this is so remains a mystery, there is limited evidence of the pygmy and dwarf whales capable of navigating the ocean deep underwater .

Greek researchers created the algorithm, which determines a person’s state of intoxication with 90% accuracy . The researchers took thermal infrared photographs of 41 volunteers’ faces, before and after drinking four glasses of wine . They then used artificial neural networks to compare the sober and drunken images . While the alcohol got some volunteers more tipsy than others, they all had a blood alcohol content of at least 50 milligrams of alcohol in every 100 millilitres of blood .

His front foot is slightly open but not too far past the line of leg stump. Earth's continents are slowly moving together, and in 50 to 200 million years they are expected to form a new supercontinent . In 2012 a study suggested this may be centered on the North Pole, causing tectonic activity . The Pacific Ocean is narrowing at a few centimetres per year, which will cause America to collide with Eurasia, while Australia is moving towards Asia by 2.8 inches (7cm) a year . Researchers are able to start examining the changes due to take place over the next tens of millions of years like
Researchers studied stone tools that were used by people in the Early Ahmarian culture and the Protoaurignacian culture, living in south and west Europe and west Asia around 40,000 years ago . They found tools were no more effective than Neanderthal-created tools of the same era . Traditionally, the study believed that innovation in weapons enabled humans to spread out of Africa to Europe .

Researchers at Yahoo Labs in California have created a sensor that can recognise the shape of your ear or any other body part you want to access your device . Called Bodyprint, the technology turns a standard touchscreen into a biometric scanner removing the need to specialist hardware such as fingerprint readers or infrared cameras . It was devised by Christian Holz, Senaka Buthpitiya and Marius Knaust . They claim it will save people around 53 hours over a year based on the belief that the average phone user unlocks their phone 150 times a
Card was created by Joel Paglione and Niko Zistakis from Illinois . They claim it will save people around 53 hours over a year . Based on belief that average user unlocks their phone 150 times a day . Device is the same height and length as an ordinary credit card . However, it's three times as thick because it has to be big enough to store the battery, which lasts for 18 months . Chip maker Qualcomm has unveiled its Sense ID 3D fingerprint scanner - the first biometric sensor using ultrasonic technology .

The Rubber Bowl in Akron, Ohio, was built in 1939 and was the home of the University of Ohio's football team, Zips . The university purchased the title to the Rubber Bowl for $1 in 1971 . It hosted 310 UA football contests, 19 preseason Cleveland Browns' games and a regular-season NFL game in 1952 . There were originally hopes the stadium could hold events like Easter sunrise services, pageants, light operas, musicals, track meets, bicycle races, softball tournaments and more .

Bon Apetit have revealed that the best way to revive a stale loaf is to run it under water before baking it in the oven . For a small loaf of bread you need to allow around 6-7 minutes and for a large, or particularly wet one, around 12 to 13 minutes . According to a nutritionist, you should be careful to check that your bread is not mouldy and should be 'watched out for mould'

The attraction, at Fancesa limestone quarry in Sucre, Bolivia, comprises some 462 trails made up of 5,055 prints . Some of the trails are more than a metre in length indicating the size of some of the vast beasts that roamed the area . The imprinted rock was once horizontal before being pushed upwards by tectonic activity . In 2009, fossil hunters came across what are thought to be among the world's largest dinosaur prints, which were made by long-necked sauropods .
Researchers from Cornell University, eBay Research Labs and the University of California, Berkeley, addressed the problem in a new paper . They found that exact prices of goods on eBay attract higher offers than those with round numbers, such as $1,000 . Sellers who end their price with ‘00’ typically receive offers that are five to eight per cent lower than the most lucrative counter offers from sellers .

Up to half of British women are thought to suffer to some degree, but far fewer seek help . Many who do the procedure are offered just one solution: a hysterectomy .

The image was created by superimposing a blurry picture of Marilyn Monroe over a picture of Albert Einstein drawn in fine lines . Features with a high spatial frequency (Einstein) are only visible when you're viewing them close up . People with low spatial frequencies (Monroe) only visible from further away . Combining pictures of the two produces a single image which changes when viewer moves closer or farther away from the screen .

Researchers from London and Edinburgh are developing a computer that can collate meteorological information and then produce forecasts as if they were written by a human . It uses a process known as 'natural language generation' (NLG) These computer-generated weather updates are being tested by scientists at Heriot-Watt University and University College London . If the project is successful, a prototype system will be tested by generating local weather reports on the MailOnline's website .

Genes for Good is a Facebook app designed to survey the health of millions of social network users, who can also submit in spit samples to tie their survey results to their genes . It was set up by biostatisticians from the University of Michigan and is available over 18s in the US . Users can withdraw at any time by clicking the withdrawal link under the 'Your Account' option in the upper right corner of the site . After withdrawing, the user deletes their name and unique Facebook ID from its database .

The distribution of desert fairy circles may look random, as if the landscape is marked with freckles, the pattern closely matches the distribution of skin cells . The circles are considered one of nature's greatest mysteries because no one knows how they form . Several teams of scientists are trying to explain the bizarre markings, and suggestions include termites nibbling grass, zebras rolling in circles, competition for resources and hydrocarbons .

The Lusitanian toadfish lives in rocky crevices in the Mediterranean Sea and Atlantic Ocean and can whistle, croak and grunt . Females make five types of calls and males can even sing in choruses to attract mates . Males build nests under rocks during mating season, which runs from May to July and sing to attract female visitors . The creature is well camouflaged so sound is the best way to get attention .

Fergus Simpson applied a mathematical formula to assume aliens obey the same laws of conservation of energy as animals do on Earth . This means that larger animals need more resources to survive, so are less common ants, for example . His calculations are also based on the idea that there’s a minimum size needed for intelligent life, but don’t factor in an alien planet’s gravity . He conclude that most species are expected to exceed 300kg in body mass .

It contains 1,000 painstakingly-reproduced drawings as well as around 450 bones and other features . Cave is the oldest cave decorated by man – and the best preserved, but not open to the public to keep the precious works of art safe .

Researchers at Gillette cut real skin samples and attempted to rip them apart by pulling them apart . They found that mammalian skin has sophisticated stress resistance properties that prevent holes and cuts from expanding . Using X-ray beams they were able to directly observe the microscopic changes that take place in the skin to help it resist tearing . Their research has shown why washing the skin is so vital and why you should never, ever tap your razor on the sink .

Fear of spiders is a survival trait written into our DNA, researchers say . It could mean that arachnophobia, one of the most crippling of phobias, represents a finely tuned survival instinct . And it could date back to early human evolution in Africa, where spiders with very strong venom existed millions of years ago .

Survey reveals the more a country paid to the unemployed or sick the more likely its residents were to want a job . In Norway, which pays the highest benefits in Europe, almost 80 per cent of people wanted work . By contrast in Estonia, one of least generous, only around 40 per cent did . People who are hungry are more inclined to support the welfare state policies that help the poor .

The Illume ArcLighter, in Canada, uses electricity to ignite candles and paper . Instead of using a spark and fuel mechanism like traditional lighters, the lighter . creates a ‘super high-intensity’ electrical arc between two ceramic electrodes . This means there is no flare ups like with matches or conventional lighters that can easily burn fingers . Its makers are raising funds to put the lighter into production on Kickstarter and have almost doubled their goal .

One Ebola jab is being given to people living in West African countries . Human trials in unaffected countries have proved successful . Scientists hope that immunisation is possible with just one injection . The vaccine is based on an animal virus called vesicular stomatitis virus (VSV) When administered, it induces an immune response against the virus . Virus has killed more than 10,460 people in a year across six countries, including Liberia, Guinea, Sierra Leone, Nigeria, the US and Mali .

By 2100 around one per cent more of the world’s population will be Muslim than Christian, with largest proportion of followers in India . Number of countries with a Christian majority is expected to decline from 159 to 151, report claims . It is thought religion will thrive due to its young population and high fertility rates, with an average of 3.1 children per woman .

Short waves collide near the surface creating weak microseismic waves . These combine with long, more powerful waves dragging across the ocean's floor to create a constant hum . In the late 1990s, however, seismologists found the planet doesn't just oscillate following quakes, and instead is vibrating at extremely low frequencies all of the time .

Perfectly identical twins have fascinated us for thousands of years . Identical twins are an endless source of fascination, yet they are not truly identical . This means they are more closely related to each other than to anyone else . Twins have a 'looking-glass effect' which extends to the positioning of internal organs . But they also share virtually identical DNA .

Delphi has completed the longest automated drive in the US, travelling from San Francisco to New York in the first coast-to-coast trip ever attempted by an automated vehicle . The team collected nearly three terabytes of data—about 30 percent of all of the printed material in the Library of Congress . Along the way, the vehicle encountered complex driving situations such as traffic circles, bridges, tunnels, aggressive drivers and a variety of weather conditions .

The phenomenon is fairly common and the number of spots on the solar surface reflects with how active the sun is . They occur when a concentration of magnetic fields causes the surface temperature to reduce, making a specific section of the sun stand out from its surroundings . Sokaze-ki Q uses fluid dynamics to take air in at the rear of the device . It moves it through specially designed channels before blasting via a turbofan . Alternatively, the Q has a '1/f fluctuation' function that reduces the force of the air flow, and sends 'natural wind' that mimics breezes . Air is drawn into the 'Q' using small inlets on the rear and are driven by the so-called impellers or bladed fins.

Unispectral Technologies and Tel Aviv University say it works by analysing a materials 'hyperspectral signature' which is its unique chemical fingerprint . Team have already patented the optical part of the system, which is based on existing microelectromechanical or 'MEMS' technology . For each pixel in an image, a hyperspectral camera acquires the light intensity for a large number of different spectral bands . Technology could help a range of industries such as food and drink, healthcare and the defence sector, the researchers claim .

Experts believe tampons could be used to detect pipes that shunt sewage into streams instead of treatment plants . Tampons absorb chemicals commonly used on toilet paper, laundry detergents and shampoos, which glow under UV light, meaning that they could shed light on previously undetectable misplumbed pathways . Around five per cent of homes in the UK have pipes that are misconnected, causing them to leak sewage .

Study found that marine photic zone euxinia took place in one of the prehistoric oceans . This happens when the sun-lit surface waters of the ocean become devoid of oxygen and are poisoned by hydrogen sulphide . Authors fear that the planet today could suffer similar consequences due to the amount of carbon dioxide being created through the burning of fossil fuels, 200 million years ago .

Until recently, Australia had two species of Bilbies- the Greater Bilby and the Lesser Bilby . Predators like feral cats and foxes are the biggest threat to the bilby populations .

FireChat launched last year and has been downloaded more than five million times . It takes advantage of a feature that launched in Apple’s iOS 7 called Multipeer Connectivity Framework (MCF) Android has a similar feature that works over Bluetooth. MCF lets you send messages even when a person has no signal by creating what is called a wireless mesh network .

Research Vessel Flip has been used by the US Office for Naval Research for more than 50 years . The RV FLIP has to be towed safely to the location of scientific study, where it turns 90 degrees . With 300 feet below the surface, the vessel becomes incredibly stable, leaving only a spine .
The One-Touch-911 was designed by researchers at Boston-based MIT . Users can call police, fire service, report a car crash or seek medical help . App triggers a standard call to nearby dispatchers, and each call is placed with the phone's GPS location, user details and any pre-entered medical information . If the user doesn't have signal, the app lets them ‘roam’ onto another network . This is a feature built into most phones already, and is compatible with any three-digit emergency number in these regions .

Pet aquarium fish are being dumped in Western Australia's waterways . They are being caught weighing up to 2kg and koi carp up to 8kg and one metre in length, amongst other exotic introduced species . The native fish in the region are less than 10cm in length like the pygmy perch or the native minnows . 'A lot of these fish are much larger than the native fish, so they prey on them and compete for habitat,' Dr David Morgan said .
Linguistics professor Shigeru Miyagawa has a different theory about what created human language . He says humans combined an 'expressive' . layer of language, as seen in birdsong, with a 'lexical' layer, as . seen in monkeys who utter isolated sounds, such as alarm calls . The 'integration hypothesis' suggests that whatever first caused them, these layers of language blended rapidly .

University of Nebraska researcher has revealed why stress is bad for you in a video . Limited periods of stress are good, as they release the hormone cortisol . This is useful in helping you recover from very tense situations . But too much will lower your immune system and make your bones fragile . This month marks the start of preliminary design work on ESA's Asteroid Impact Mission, or AIM, which will take place in two parts . AIM will perform high-resolution visual, thermal and radar mapping of the moon to build detailed maps of its surface and interior structure . Now, it can also permanently damage the retina and lead to macular degeneration, which causes dark patches to appear in the centre of the field of vision . Modern LED screens produced from about 2007 onwards emit up to five times as much blue light as older technology .

YouTube is set to offer an ad free, subscription-based service for the first time, according to an email sent out to YouTube Partners . The additional monetization option requires partners to agree to updated terms on YouTube's Creator Studio Dashboard, which notes that the changes will go into effect on June 15, 2015 . YouTube will pay creators 55% of the total net revenues from subscription fees – the same percentage associated with advertising revenues .

In Slovakia women were doused with buckets of water as part of their weekend celebrations . A similar age-old tradition takes place in Hungary, where women give men beautifully coloured eggs in return . Easter horseback parade, known as the Georgiritt, dates back to the 18th century and is held in Traustein, Germany .

Experts wanted to find out whether the rodents do this as a reflex reaction, or to communicate their discomfort to others . More than two-thirds of people taking antidepressants did not meet the criteria for major depressive disorder, which is also known as clinical depression . But 38 per cent of those taking the drugs didn't meet criteria for obsessive compulsive disorder, panic disorder, social phobia or generalised anxiety disorder either . The report was published in the Journal of Clinical Psychiatry .

Some of the elephants will live out their post-performance lives in the center, while others will be used for breeding . This will hopefully increase genetic diversity in the species and increase its population .

The Cheyenne Mountain Complex in Colorado was built for the military command and control center of the United States in the event of World War Three . The high tech base entered popular culture with . appearances in the 1983 thriller War Games and 1994's Stargate - which . imagined the complex as a clandestine home for intergalactic travel . It shut down nearly ten years ago as the threat from Russia seemed to subside .

Genetic analysis has shown that hunter gatherers living in Spain up to 8,500 years ago still had dark skin . Around 5,800 years ago the second gene, which makes skin colour lighter still, also began to spread . Population of hunter gatheringers living on the site of Motala, southern Sweden, had already developed both skin-lightening genes . The research was presented at the 84th annual meeting of the American Association of Physical Anthropologists .

The Planetary Society says Nasa could afford to send US astronauts to Mars by 2033 and onto the Red Planet's surface by 2039 . It concludes such a plan could fit within NASA's human space exploration budget - but that politics is holding the decision back . Crewmembers would be able to study Phobos and Deimos, Mars' other moon, and potentially teleoperate rovers on the Martian surface .

The United States' National Defense Reserve Fleet was set up after the Second World War in 1945 to provide back-up in case of war . At its peak in 1952, the NDRF consisted of 2,277 ships, reduced to 230 by 2007, and 122 in April last year . Today just over 120 ships remain, posing a risk to the environment in the bays where they are moored .

The patent was filed by the California-based firm in March 2011 . It details a method of scanning a user's face using the front-facing camera . Each time the phone is moved into a certain position, the phone unlocks . This means that if the scanned face matches a previously taken photo, the device unlocks automatically . Android Lollipop users already have an almost identical feature known as 'Trusted face' in the Smart Lock menu .

Research led by the University of Montana has found that eating fast food after a workout may be just as beneficial as dietary supplements . In the study, 11 male athletes were asked to fast for 12 hours, before a 90-minute endurance workout . After this, half were fed hot cakes, hash browns and orange juice, followed by a burger, fries and a Coke two hours later . Just eight minutes of high-intensity cycling was more beneficial than going at a moderate pace for 25 minutes - the current recommended level .

Children who ate a diet higher in saturated fats had slower reaction times and a poorer working memory, according to a new study . University of Illinois researchers recruited 150 children and gave them a task-switching game to complete . The game was designed to test cognitive flexibility, which is our ability to shift attention, select information and alter our response strategy . It was then compared with a food diary that the children had completed with the help of their parents, which was overseen by a dietician .

Some of the injuries may have been sustained during combat with other tyrannosaurs, but others may have occurred after death . The theory follows analysis of skeletons of Tarbosaurus bataar from 90 sites in Gobi Desert, Mongolia .

National Institute on Drug Abuse in the US has admitted in its revised publication on marijuana that the drug offers benefits to some cancer patients . The term medicinal marijuana refers to using the whole unprocessed plant or its basic extracts to treat a disease or symptom . Studies of the chemicals in marijuana has led the FDA to approve two medications that contain cannabinoid chemicals . Currently two cannabinoids of around 100 are of medical interest . THC increases appetite and reduces nausea, may decrease pain, inflammation and muscle control problems .

Woman, 77, was struck by lightning while sitting in her car as she sat in car . Days later, her hairdresser noticed her eye sight was blurred - she could barely see with her right eye - and referred to opthalmologist Mohit Gupta . He scanned the patient's retina using a relatively new technique known as optical coherence tomography (OCT) Days later a scan of her retina revealed she had a hole in her retina - responsible for around 90 per cent of a person's vision .

Model contains more than 30,000 figures and illustrates key moments of the battle which allowed the Duke of Wellington to defeat Napoleon's forces . It was built in the 1970s, but fell into disrepair before being restored to its former glory just in time for the battle's bicentenary, which falls on June 18 of this year . The model has 21,500 soldiers and 10,000 horses, illustrating not just the major military events - but also a third of the true number who took part .
Neuroscientists at UCLA examined the brains of 90 women, 44 of whom took the Pill, and 46 who experienced natural cycles . The lateral orbitofrontal cortex and the posterior cigulate cortex were thinner in those women taking the Pill . They believe it could account for increased anxiety and depressive symptoms .

The two continents are linked at Panama, but there has been a debate about when this land bridge first appeared . Before the Isthmus of Panama rose from the sea by tectonic and volcanic action, the Central American Seaway linked the Atlantic to the Pacific as one great ocean . Until then, a deep water channel called the Central America Seaway separated the continents . The researchers claim that a bridge, perhaps a transient one, was present since 13 to 15 million years ago .

Scientists at Rockefeller University in New York believe a new antibody therapy could pave the way for an HIV vaccine . The neutralising antibody was designed to block the key viral protein receptor that is needed to infect human blood cells . As a result patients injected with the antibody saw a 300-fold reduction in their viral load in sufferers' blood . Anti-retroviral drugs currently used can fight a wide range of HIV strains .

Experts studied 40 million posts by 1.7 million users on CNN.com, Breitbart.com and gaming site IGN.com over an 18-month period . They then divided users into those most likely to be banned, called Future-Banned Users (FBUs) and other users dubbed NBUs . The research was carried out by PhD students from Stanford and Cornell University, led by Justin Chang, in a paper called Antisocial Behavior in Online Discussion Communities .

Geologist Dr Danny Hilman believes a site in West Java is revered because it hides an ancient temple built between 9,000 and 20,000 years ago . The site of Gunung Padang was discovered in 1914 and is the largest site of its kind in Indonesia . Chunks of volcanic rubble jut out from the stepped hillside, which is considered sacred by the Sundanese people who live locally . If true, the claim could shed light on an obscure yet powerful and advanced ancient civilisation .
Immerse is available from Firebox for £29.95 ($45). It works with any Android and iOS phone that can run virtual reality apps from the respective stores, and will play any 3D movie . The maximum size of compatible devices is 3.5 x 5.7-inches (8.2 x 15.4cm) It has an earphone slot to truly immerse the wearer in whatever they are watching . Other features include 360° head tracking and an 'ultra-wide field of view' - although the exact degree of view isn't listed .

The best sleep quality worldwide occurs on a Wednesday night . While on Tuesdays, Americans rise at 7am and are in the worst mood all week . Slovakia tops the list, while the UK was in 45th place . Over the course of the week, people in Finland get the most hours sleep - Saturday with eight hours and two minutes, on average .

Modern-day Martin Burgess Clock B is based on John Harrison's design . He thought up to solve the problem of determining longitude at sea . Clock was initially set ticking after being strapped to observatory pillar . But it quickly became apparent trial would be a success and wax seals were placed on case so it could be verified . Time was measured using radio-controlled clock, which received national time signal, and BT speaking clock .

Tony Morris QC is mounting a landmark legal challenge against Queensland's speed-camera laws . The barrister says he wasn't driving when his Volvo was photographed doing 57km/h in a 50k/h zone last year . He has invoked a spousal privilege case from 1817, arguing it's unconstitutional for a Queensland court to fine him when there's evidence he was not the driver . Mr Morris says a husband can't be compelled to provide information that incriminates his wife .

App feeds information about energy consumption of devices it’s recognised back to an app, where users can make decisions about how to save power and money by turning gadgets off .

A recent British Heart Foundation survey quizzed 2,000 parents with children under the age of 16 . Two fifths of them are badgered by their children each week to buy food after seeing it advertised on TV . Despite regulation, children in the UK are still being exposed to more TV advertising for unhealthy than healthy food items . Durham University scientists studied a 'clump' of dark matter that appears to be lagging behind its galaxy - suggesting it interacts with itself . This is despite seeming to account for 85 per cent of the universe’s mass and having an observable effect on galaxies . Until now it was thought that dark matter did not interact with anything other than gravity, earning it its ‘dark’ moniker . But analysis of the clump suggests it may not be as oblivious to our universe as we thought .

The Michigan Micro Mote is the first complete computer system measuring as small as two millimeters across . It contains solar cells that power the battery with ambient light, allowing the computers to run perpetually . Phoenix's miniscule at 915 x 915m2, boasts ultra-low operating voltage and a unique standby mode that results in an average power consumption of only 500pW .

Gopher tortoises can't swim, said Florida Wildlife officials this week after people tried to throw baby turtles in the ocean . According to the Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission, all five species of sea turtle and the gopher turtle nest in the sand . Sea turtles have flippers with just one or two claws present on each fore flipper .

Qasr al-Farid is a rock-cut tomb and part of an ancient Nabatean settlement in the northwestern region of the Arabian peninsula . Believed to be constructed in the first century A.D. and situated on one of the most important trade routes, linking the north and south . Despite its misleading name, the four-storey monument was actually used as a tomb . It's intricate carving borrows decorative elements from Egyptian, Hellenistic and Assyrian architecture .

Researchers from Germany, Canada and the United States analysed answers to the Hitler question from 6,100 people . They found that significantly more men than women would kill to save lives further down the line, while women were more troubled by the act itself . Other dilemmas included a scenario where people were hiding from soldiers trying to kill them, but were about to be given away by a baby crying .

Anti-fungal agent miconazole and steroid clobetasol both restored movement to mice paralysed by a rodent version of multiple sclerosis (MS) In laboratory tests, they prompted inactive mouse and human stem cells to regenerate myelin, the protective coating-like coating around nerve fibres that is destroyed by the disease .

The US Geological Survey compiled two sets of maps including image mosaics and topographical views of the lunar landscape . The grey and white areas reveal higher peaks, while darker blues show deep craters . To create the maps, more than 6.5 billion measurements were collected between 2009 and 2013 by the Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter Wide Angle Camera .

The interactive map was created by writer Levi Pearson using dataset from the National UFO Reporting Centre and open source software from CartoDB . It begins in 1933 with the first sightings being spotted over California and Nebraska in the US, the UK and France in Europe, and locations in Japan and Australia . In the 1950s and 1960s, radar operators spotted a UFO within 120 miles of Los Angeles that moved at incredible speed before vanishing . YouTuber Dave Hax’s kitcken trick lets cooks peel potatoes without using a peeler . The process starts by running the blade of a sharp knife carefully around the middle of the potato, without letting it cut through, making sure to get the line to meet up on the other side . When the potatoes are ready, drain the water into another pan, leaving the potatoes in the first one .

There are at least 200 billion Earth-like planets in our galaxy - and now Nasa claims we could be on the verge of finding life on one of them .

Men spent twice as much as women on computers, digital accessories, mobile apps, and streaming services . Families with children living at home are spending 50 per cent more to stay digitally connected to the world than singles, couples without children and empty nesters . Mobile phone bills were the biggest expense, and also the biggest disparity for families .

Number of Christians in the US will decline from three quarters of population in 2010 to just two thirds in 2050 . Percentage of atheists across the globe is expected to fall across the same time frame, while Muslims will outnumber Christians by 2070 . Those who do not affiliate with any religion will make up a 'declining share' of the world's population - even if their numbers are increasing in countries such as the U.S., the UK and France .

Nasa has finalised an ambitious mission to send a probe closer to the sun . Over 24 orbits, the mission will use seven flybys of Venus to reduce its distance . The spacecraft and instruments will be protected from the sun’s heat by a 4.5-inch-thick carbon-composite shield . During the closest passes around the sun, temperatures outside the spacecraft will reach nearly 2,500 degrees Fahrenheit .

40 miles north of San Antonio, stands a lonely, tin-sided building that hints at Texas' past . Kendalia Halle was built more than 100 years ago by German immigrants, who through the latter half of the 19th century comprised more than 5 percent of the state's population . About 400 such halls still stand — many unused and decaying — but only two traditional Texas dance halls continue to operate .

Kuku Kube is a free game on Facebook, Android, iOS and desktop browsers . It is designed to put your colour vision and eyesight to the test by showing boards of coloured squares on each board . The aim is to find this odd square by tapping it with your finger or clicking it with the mouse . Scores lower than 11 are poor, scores between 15 and 20 is 'lower than average', 21 to 30 is considered normal or average .

Researchers have completed the first comprehensive study of the microbes living on and in and uncontacted tribe from the Amazon . There are about 26,000 Yanomami living in Brazil and 15,000 in Venezuela, mostly in federally protected reserves near rivers and in remote mountains . The group harbors the highest diversity of bacteria and genetic functions ever reported in a human group .

Scientists in California have described how to create artificial auroras on Earth . They said a particle accelerator could be sent 185 miles (300km) up into space . It would then fire high-energy beams back at Earth's atmosphere . Then a beam fired from the machine would last just 0.1 microseconds . Startup would be three times stronger than anything like it before .
Washington, DC-based United Space Structures wants to create a new space station . Their giant cylinder could apparently replace the ISS . It would rotate four times per minute to create artificial gravity, and would be 1,300ft (400 metres) long, cost £200 billion ($300 billion) and take 30 years to build . The force would be the same as the gravity experienced on Earth . Meanwhile on ISS, the station is in constant freefall towards Earth as it orbits the planet - so the astronauts live in ‘zero-gravity’

Neanderthals may have cut and fractured the bones of deceased relatives . This is according to cuts found on the fossils of two adults and a child . They are an incomplete diaphysis – or the middle part of long bones - of a right forearm bone, another of the left leg bone and the majority of the right thigh bone . Researchers from Complutense University of Madrid and the lead authors said some groups cut and tore apart child or adult corpses shortly after death .

The temperature in the South is forecast to reach 24C today and 25C tomorrow, surpassing the highest seen so far this year . The delightful weather, caused by warm air blowing up from the Azores, is creating conditions we might usually experience in July or August . Filmmaker Michael König from Cologne, Germany has created an amazing video showing solar activity . It was made by stitching together footage from Nasa's Solar Dynamics Observatory over five years . The movie, called Sun, uses footage recorded by Nasa’s solar Dynamics Observatory between 2011 and 2015 . Highlights include plasma raining down on the sun, an extreme solar eruption and even a comet breezing through the sun’s atmosphere . Other fantastic sections show bright, active regions on the surface as it bursts with energy .

Photographer Denis Budkov, 35, trekked inside the caves - which could collapse at any moment - to capture colourful scenes . The ice cave's unique formations are created by the heavy winter snow becoming compressed and forming ice . As the short, summer months arrive, intensive melting of the ice creates ravines, and Mr Budkov captures them .

Two prototypes of the CYG-11 seaplane were tested over the sea off the coast of Haikou in China . The aircraft is believed to be a joint project between Russia and China to build new types of super-efficient aircraft . By placing the wings low on the fuselage of the aircraft, lift is increased and drag decreases when an aircraft's wings are close to the ground . Engineers behind the £500 million (£500 million) project say the aircraft are capable of flying 62 miles (1,500 km) on 28 litres of fuel .

Includes hand-drawn diagram, plane that bombed Hiroshima was told to arrive at 30,000ft, then veer away sharply at 28,500ft . Biologists at Jyväskylä University in Finland say that eye-spots on the wings of butterflies do in fact mimic the eyes of larger and more threatening species, like owls . They say the insects help to lure them away from vital body parts . A moth has an unusual evolutionary adaptation that allows it to confuse the ultrasound used by bats, and makes the bats target the end of the tails rather than the moth itself .

Researchers isolated bacterial DNA of several strains of the disease from the bodies of mummies found in the Dominican church in Vác, Hungary . Found 14 different strains that had infected eight of the bodies in the tomb and traced them back to a single source . Warwick University researchers say the TB they found all evolved from a . single germ that had began infecting people during the late Roman period .

Train is able to go this fast because it makes use of a charge to lift and move it above a guideway . It hovers four inches (10cm) above the tracks and is propelled by electrically charged magnets . Doctors at University College London Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust start vital treatment much sooner using a single procedure . It even allows them to assess instantly the type and severity of the cancer . Procedure involves inserting the EBUS down the throat, guided by a tiny camera fitted to the tube . An ultrasound scanner attached to one end of the tube takes a scan while a small needle takes one tissue sample . Findings from a three-year trial at UCLH reveal that the method halves the time it takes between a patient’s first hospital appointment and for a decision

The Great Dying took place over a 60,000-year period, and acidification of the oceans lasted for around 10,000 years . Huge volumes of viscous basalt lava covered an area roughly seven times the size of France . Sulphur dioxide from these eruptions caused vinegar-like acid rain to cover the Earth . At this time, a single supercontinent called Pangaea covered the Earth, and by the Late Permian, temperatures were at an all time high .

Human remains found in Gough's Cave in Somerset had the flesh cut from them before being chewed and crushed . Archaeologists found tooth marks on many of the bones, which were discovered in the cave between 1880 and 1992 . The findings suggest people living in the late Ice Age indulged in ritual cannibalism, perhaps as a macabre way to revere their dead kin .

Many nations are looking into Carbon Capture and Storage technologies as a way to cut their greenhouse house emissions . In the past year solar power in the UK has more than doubled while in the US it has grown by 30 per cent . Many current systems fail to solve the problem of how energy is managed and used overnight . Traditionally, energy gathered during the day is used by solar panels, but this can prove costly if you need to buy it back . When there is energy in the battery available, the connection to the grid is locked . It additionally has a Sleep mode that automatically goes into standby when not in use . In case of emergency, users can use their cell phones to store excess energy

Now, their mother has appealed to others not to smoke the drug, which has wrecked sons' bodies and left youngest, Jeff, with permanent kidney damage .

Study found that those who were overweight had an 18 per cent lower risk of dementia compared to those with a healthy BMI . Being underweight increased the dementia risk by 39 per cent . Three years ago an even larger study reported that overweight people tended to live longer than those of normal weight .

Norwich scientists have developed an adaptor for colour blindness . Eye2TV can be plugged into any HDMI port on a TV or a computer monitor . A remote control or app then adjusts the colour adjustment . It allows colour blind people to watch shows they otherwise couldn't . The team is seeking £100,000 ($150,000) of funding to get their project of the ground .

The USS Independence is resting 800m underwater off California's Farallon Islands with its hull and deck very well preserved and clearly visible . There also appears to be a plane in the hangar bay of the vessel, scientists with the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration said on Thursday . The veteran ship even survived an atomic bomb test after being chosen as a 'target vessel' for Operation Crossroads in 1946 .

Up to 90 per cent of people with REM behavior disorder (RBD) will develop a neurological condition within a decade of being diagnosed . Those with the condition move around in their sleep and 'act out' their dreams . They physically move limbs or even get up and engage in activities associated with waking . This can range from making small hand movements to thrashing around and punching opponents in their beds .

Police were met by a boy, thought to be Wright's brother, at the scene . They were trying to move Owen's belongings out of a garage when an argument broke out, according to the man's younger brother .

Families across China marked the annual 'Tomb Sweeping Festival' this weekend by travelling home to their ancestral villages . Families descended on graveyards to clean their tombs and honour their loved ones, burning fake paper money and leaving their favourite food and drink . In Shaanxi Province, a huge outdoor celebration was held in honour of the 'Yellow Emperor' Huang Di, considered the founding father of the Chinese nation . The festival falls in the first week of April every year, and is one of 24 Chinese solar terms .

Lawyers have warned that the documentary might not be broadcast by Sky Atlantic because of differences in defamation law in Northern Ireland . The Alex Gibney-directed film was due to premiere in the UK earlier this month to coincide with its American release . But the fact that Northern Ireland is not subject to the 2013 Defamation Act means Sky is set to postpone or cancel the show entirely .

Radioactive element lawrencium currently sits at the bottom of the periodic table . It is notoriously difficult to make and only exists for a few seconds at a time . If it is redrawn, chemistry students could have to relearn the order of how the elements appear .
Indonesia tops the list of countries with the most threatened mammals . Madagascar is second, with 114 endangered mammals, while Mexico is third . Deforestation in the region is leaving many species at risk, including orangutans and critically endangered Sumatran tigers and rhinos . The maps were designed by London-based Eco Experts using data from the World Bank's World Development Indicator . Lancaster University recently surveyed households in the cities of Borba and Novo Aripuan .

The map was created using data from Nasa’s Tropical Rainfall Measuring Mission satellite and the Orbview-1/Microlab satellite . Lightning occurs more often over land than it does over oceans . This is because solid earth absorbs sunlight and heats up faster than water, so there is greater atmospheric instability . For example, lightning occur over land . regardless of where you are in the world, lightning bolts are at their most powerful at 8am .

The defective BRAC1 gene results in inherited breast and ovarian cancer . By repairing the gene, the resulting egg could be made healthy .

Scientists have joined the individual 30 to 60 mile (50 to 100km) wide strips together to create a single complete 3D map . The map allows astronomers to 'stand' on planetary surfaces and could help explain how water and lava once flowed across the red planet . It covers the vast crater-strewn highland region of the Red planet, as well as parts of the Ares Vallis outflow channel .

Nasa scientists in California have released new images of Ceres . They were taken by the Dawn spacecraft from a distance of 21,000 miles (33,000km) The spacecraft is beginning to move closer and closer to the planet - including its mystery bright spots . And over the coming months it will see more of the world in light - and it will also have better and a higher resolution . It is the first spacecraft to orbit a dwarf planet since September 2012 .

A search of his computer was launched after the picture appeared on social media site Snapchat . Chairman of the Gealong College council, Dr Hugh Seward, said the matter was a serious breach of the school's standards . 'As no point' did Mr Barr's actions affect the care provided to students .
More than 25 women have been airlifted from Royal Navy ships because of pregnancy, FOI reveals . One ship - HMS Ocean – even had five pregnant sailors removed in emergency 'medevacs' Ministry of Defence confirm strict 'no touching' rule in place at sea . Rule suggests women conceived before boarding the ships or during leave . Last May three women made history by becoming the first female submariners to serve in the Royal Navy .

The storm formed in the worst possible spot, which was just north of Newcastle . It then covered 150km south from Newcastle to Wollongong where a third of Australia’s population live .

Flowers infected with deadly xylella fastidiosa bacteria have ravaged olive trees in the Puglia region and contributed to a 35 percent drop in the region's olive oil production last year . Protesters tried unsuccessfully to block the trees from being felled in Oria, near Brindisi, saying it won't contain the bacteria's spread .
Genetic analysis of bones found in limestone in Altamura, Italy, shows they belong to a Neanderthal who fell down a sinkhole around 150,000 years ago . The bones were fused to the walls of the cave and are believed to be brutish creatures who chomped their way through huge hunks of meat .
Hunchback Friedrich Brandt, 23, was killed in 1815 by Napoleon's forces . He was found with a musket ball between his ribs in Bexhill-on-Sea . It took three years of intense research to pin-point Brandt's identity . Historians had to use what little records remain from the 1815 battle to piece together the story .
Billions of jellyfish spotted in water off the coast of Devon and Cornwall . Jellyfish can grow up to six feet and weigh 55lb and is 'eerie and a little unnerving' Sea life cruiser stunned to find thousands of the jellyfish over a mile .
Researchers have found that bird species are continuing to drop in Fukushima . The barn swallow, for example, dropped from hundreds to dozens . This is despite radiation levels in the region starting to fall . And comparing it to Chernobyl could reveal what the future holds .

Around 20 million sufferers in the UK are expected to suffer hayfever symptoms this summer, up a third from last year, pollen experts told MailOnline . Pollen causes streaming eyes, incessant sneezing and irritating itches at the back of the throat - for the first time . By 2030 that figure is expected to surge to 31.8million sufferers .
The YouGov poll of more than 2,000 Britons revealed that we consume an average of 17 cups of tea each week . Those aged 55 and over typically enjoy 21 cups a week compared with 18 to 24-year-olds, who only drink eight cups each week. Nearly a quarter of 18 to 25s say they put the kettle on when they are feeling down, compared to just 11% of men .

Scientists may have captured the song of a new species of whale living in the Antarctic . The song can't be identified and doesn't fit the pattern of noise generated by the few known species of beaked whales . Experts have recorded the noise more than 1,000 times to conclude that it’s unique in the composition of sounds making the signal and in timing .

Primatologists at Iowa State University recorded 300 hunts by chimps . Females were using tools to capture prey in 60 per cent of the observations . Males tend to prefer capturing prey with their hands, research shows . The findings suggest early females were perhaps the first to begin fashioning simple tools to help them hunt .

Nasa has spotted an exoplanet 13,000 light-years away, making it one of the most distant planets ever found . The planet was discovered using a technique known as microlensing . This happens when one star happens to pass in front of another, and its gravity acts as a lens to magnify and brighten the more distant star's light . It could help astronomers gain a better understanding of the distribution of planets in the Milky Way .

A series of earthquakes that rattled a small Texan community have been linked to nearby oil and gas operations . In 84 days from November 2013 to January 2014, the area around Azle, Texas, shook with 27 magnitude two or greater earthquakes . Scientists believe these earthquakes were the result of high-pressure injection of drilling wastewater into the ground .

Tamoxifen is the main hormonal therapy drug given to women who have not been through the menopause . Most breast cancer tumours rely on hormone oestrogen to grow . This means cancer either grows more slowly or stops growing altogether . Swedish and British researchers looked at data from 1,090 breast cancer patients .
The new approach will target cancer stem cells that evade conventional drugs and cause the tumour to re-grow . Cancer that has spread and is incurable, known as secondary breast cancer, kills 1,000 women in Britain every month .

Process of cloud seeding was first proposed in the 1940s at General Electric labs in Schenectady, New York . Since 2007, CAP has put about $1 million toward research happening in other states to increase the supply of water in the Colorado River system . The Pentagon announced Tuesday it would exhume the bodies of some 400 sailors and Marines killed in the 1941 bombing of Pearl Harbor . Only 35 were identified in the years immediately after . In 1950, they were reburied as unknowns at the National Memorial Cemetery of the Pacific in Honolulu . The Pentagon is acting now, nearly 75 years after the men died, because advances in forensic science and technology have made it possible to identify more remains .

They looked at ornamental ornaments worn by different populations in the Early Neolithic period, which stretched from 8,000 to 5,000 BC . The findings show a bump in the road in the adoption of farming, which enabled groups of people to move away from foraging and hunting as a means for survival .

Unusual tomb dates back to Korea’s Silla Dynasty between 5th and 6th century . Skeletons of the two people, including leg bones and teeth, were found in the main chamber of the tomb and are thought to have died between the ages of 20 and 30 . Experts believe the tomb was intended for the woman because her body was carefully positioned to face the sky and she was buried with gold earrings, indicating her high status . No precious possessions were found with the male body, leading experts to speculate that he was a sex slave

Spanish researchers say climate change impacted human migration . Until 1.4 million years ago it was too cold to inhabit southeast Spain . But then the climate warmed to 13°C (55°F) and became more humid . This enabled hominins - our distant ancestors - to move to new regions . The research was led by Dr Jordi Agusti from the Catalan Institution for Research and Advanced Studies (ICREA)

The study was conducted by scientists at Purdue University in Indiana . They were investigating how to reduce bird to aircraft collisions by keeping birds away from planes . Research showed that birds responded most to blue lights on aircraft . When planes were stationary, the birds became alert more quickly when the lights were on . But when it approached them with its lights off, their response slowed . Birds were more alert when they approached the aircraft in this colour . Scientists from Harvard and Massachusetts General Hospital have developed a device that clips onto the smartphone . It uses the powerful cameras available now on most smartphones in combination with tiny beads that bind to cancerous cells . When added to a tissue or blood sample, these microbeads change the way the light is scattered by the sample . They produce distinctive diffraction patterns in in the image if clumped together . Each test costs around £1.20 ($1.80) and the device can return results within two minutes .

Dr Zoe Waller has skin condition dermatographia - a type of urticaria, or hives . A raised, itchy rash appears on the skin at the slightest pressure . It is thought to be caused when the cells under the surface of the skin release histamines as part of an allergic reaction, causing the skin to swell . Her students are required to learn 100 drugs for their course and each day will draw a new one on their skin .

In 2018, Nasa will launch the Orion spacecraft using the largest, most powerful rocket booster ever built; the Space Launch System (SLS) The space agency has revealed three missions that will use these small satellites, each about the size of a large shoebox . The first is a Near-Earth Asteroid Scout, using solar sail propulsion, will fly by a small asteroid, taking pictures and making observations . This will help scientists develop new technologies for astronauts travelling to deep space .

US researchers say very few diets have solid evidence to back up their claims . Some produce no better results than people dieting on their own or getting health information elsewhere, while some may actually be harmful to health . But a handful - including Weight Watchers, Atkins diet, Jenny Craig and NutriSystem - do appear to be effective according to long-term studies .

The Maglev train completed a test run on a track in Yamanashi, Japan . It beat the previous record of 361mph (580km/h) set in 2003 . trains use magnets to lift carriages above the track . This eliminates the need for wheels and therefore any incidence of friction . The trains are expected to eventually consist of 16 carriages and carry up to 1,000 passengers at a time .

Tokyo researchers have proposed a laser system to attach to the ISS . It would be used to shoot down pieces of debris in Earth orbit . The system would have a range of 62 miles (100km) and could target things less than 0.4 inches (1cm) in size . Powerful pulses from the laser would push space junk into Earth’s atmosphere, where it would burn up .

In the third part of our Good Health series on dementia we look at ways to minimise the impact of these memory problems . During deep sleep, brain waves move memories from the hippocampus - the area that is involved in short-term memory - to the prefrontal cortex at the front of the brain . Short-term memories get overwritten with new ones and we need just as much . One of the most important measures is to avoid catnapping during the day . This becomes harder to fall asleep at night and more likely you'll wake up earlier than desired .

The images were taken by the Osiris camera on the Rosetta spacecraft . As the comet gets closer to the sun, its surface gets warmer, causing frozen gases to erupt from the surface, carrying dust particles . It’s not clear if the jet caused the jet - or an explosion of material caused by ice sublimating (turning from solid to gas) underground . In the second image, a spectacular new jet emerges from the dark side, hurling dust into space at 26ft .

A 'blob' of warm water 2,000 miles across is sitting in the Pacific Ocean . Since last June it has extended from Alaska to Mexico . It has been present since 2013 and causing fish to seek shelter elsewhere . And a University of Washington study says it could be responsible for droughts . The study found that a high-pressure ridge could be causing the blob . This would trap heat in the water, trapping heat and create a 'mega-drought' California is currently experiencing the driest period since 1580 .

Encounters with common dolphins off the west of Scotland have more than doubled over a decade . They were once drawn to warmer waters above 10°C south of the area . But climate change is causing sea surface temperatures in the Hebrides to rise . The dolphins are moving further north than they did decades ago, possibly because the water has become warmer . Warmer water species appear to be colonising new areas further north or closer to shore, the research body said .

Researchers at Technical University of Braunschweig, Germany, showed for the that that peppermint plants can take up high concentrations of nicotine from contaminated soil and plumes of smoke . The finding may explain why some spices, herbal teas and medicinal plants have . high levels of nicotine in them despite not being allowed in insecticides . Nicotine was frequently used as an insecticide until it was banned by the European Union in 2009 because of its toxicity .

The albino dolphin has been at the Taiji Whale Museum in southern Japan . While bottlenose dolphins are typically grey, the mammal is completely white . It can change colour from white to pink when it's feeling angry, sad or embarrassed . Animal is believed to be only the second one ever put on display in an aquarium after it was bought from fishermen last year .

Modular Robotic Vehicle, or MRV, was developed at NASA's Johnson Space Center . It is driven by four independent wheel modules called e-corners . The vehicles can be controlled independently and rotated 180 degrees about its axis . Movement can also be controlled remotely at up to 70mph . Nasa says it was buit in order to 'end technologies that have applications for future vehicles on Earth'
Thousands of blue-blue creatures are washing up on beaches in Oregon, California and Washington . Strong winds have blown them to the shores thanks to a blue sail on their bodies which allows them to stay in the sea during normal winds . They will smell like fish as they start to decompose and will likely be gone within days .

Turkey hunting season begins in April and ends at the end of May, and is allowed in designated areas around the St. Cloud Regional Airport, in Minnesota . For £7 ($10) permit holders can hunt wild turkey in 200 stunning acres of land . Hunting is a rich part of Pennsylvania's history and airport states on its website that hunting deer helps to meet its wildlife hazard management goals .

Boston University and Bath researchers say Neanderthals lost out when modern humans arrived from Africa around 40,000 years ago . They used computer models the amount of energy they would have able get from their food without cooking it compared to humans that were . Without fire, a group would have had less energy - the equivalent 12 reindeer a year - than if they did . Instead, they were not driven to extinction by their lack of brains, they say .

In U.S. schools last year, almost 800 school employees were prosecuted for sexual assault, nearly a third of them women . Scientists in Belgium say all sweet potatoes contain 'foreign DNA' Agrobacterium bacteria in the crop exchanges genes between species . This makes sweet potatoes a 'natural genetically modified organism' And humans have been eating it for thousands of years .

In 2013 the US Department of Veterans Affairs reported hearing loss as one of the most common ailments among veterans receiving disability compensation . Now scientists at the University of Southern California believe they have made a breakthrough in their understanding of the condition . They identified a gene, named Nox3, that is crucial in determining how vulnerable a person is to developing hearing loss .

University of Illinois scientists have created the first 3D simulation of merging black holes in a disk . It shows what happens when two supermassive black holes collide in just seven years . The video swoops around the disc of superheated material known as a quasar surrounding the black hole, showing how it takes shape . They include gravitational waves - ripples in space-time - in the merger of the black holes .

Palaeontologists at the University of Alberta examined two fossils found in Mongolia, which were first described in 2001 . One is a complete skeleton, while the other is missing the middle and end of its tail . Another is missing its tail and the middle of the tail - likely from birds . It suggests the dinosaurs used its giant bony protrusions, which could reach 2.5 feet, to attract mates .

54 per cent confessed they did not know that Lyme disease affects pets . The nervous system, joints and heart can be affected and symptoms may be misdiagnosed as other conditions, such as rheumatoid arthritis and multiple sclerosis . Ticks in undergrowth are likely to attach to deer but can also be found on foxes, badgers, mice, birds as well as domestic pets - responsible for carrying ticks into urban areas .

Professor David Healy argues that the idea that most popular antidepressants raise serotonin levels in the brain is 'nothing more than a myth' SSRIs were introduced after concerns about tranquilliser use to treat depression . In the late 1980s the drugs took off because they were weaker than old-style tricyclic tricyclis . But in the 1990s there was no evidence that treatment corrected anything . The controversy might harm depressed patients if they were deterred from taking the drugs, which had been proved to work in trials and the ‘

Massey Shaw was requisitioned from the London Fire Brigade in 1940 . It helped with the evacuation of Allied troops in the face of the Nazi advance .
