Biologists from Goethe University Frankfurt, Germany, used cells from fruit fly embryos to study the healing processes in skin . They found that the skin cells on either side of the wound begin by 'sniffing' each other out to find their opposing partners . The cells then develop adhesive like structure made of microscopic tubes that pull them closer together so they interlock like a zip .

The Lyrid shower is created by debris from comet Thatcher - which takes about 415 years to orbit around the Sun . It is expected to peak tonight with between 10 and 20 meteors an hour . The annual celestial event has been observed for the last 2,700 years across the globe but is most visible in northern hemisphere .

Researchers at the University of Bath and Yale University created the device . It uses a newly designed catalyst to split water in an electrolyser and create clean and storable hydrogen fuel . The catalyst is more efficient at performing the crucial oxidation half of the reaction than any other existing material . But the first part of the process can be done quite efficiently - the latter was more difficult and lots of energy is lost .

Women who carry a mutated version of BRCA1 or another gene known as BRCA2 face a life-time risk of breast cancer of up to 70 per cent . Having an oophorectomy was associated with a significant drop of 62 per cent in breast cancer death in women with oRCA1 mutation . They were found to reduce a 65 per cent reduction in death from all causes . Women who had the gene removed within two years had a 73% reduction .

Identical twins start life with same genes because they come from the same fertilised egg which divides into two embryos . As they age different life experiences, such as smoking or diet, create variations in the number of hydrogen bonds in the DNA . The more hydrogen bonds that are present in DNA, the higher the temperature required to melt them . In 2013, 22-year-old twins Mohammed and Aftab Asghar were both charged with raping a 17 year old woman in Berkshire . Mohammed was eventually convicted by a jury at Reading Crown Court, and charges dropped

In 1677, Dutch natural scientist Antoni van Leeuwenhoek embarked on an extraordinarily gruesome experiment, using his body as a guinea pig . He took three lice, nestled them among the hairs of his calf, rolled up a tight stocking so that the insects were bound to his leg and then left the stocking on . The stocking went back on for another three days but at least 25 lice ran up and down his leg .

United Nations University says only 6million tonnes of that was recycled properly . 'Millions of tonnes' of broken goods are being dumped in landfills like Agbogbloshie in Ghana . Defunct televisions, computers, microwaves and refrigerators are being transported to African countries like Ghana because it is cheaper than recycling them properly in their countries of origin .

US researchers examined the brains of more than 900 people aged 60 and over who did not have dementia or a history of strokes . They found that living near congested roads can lead to ‘silent strokes’ which in turn cause shrinkage of the brain and other damage . PM2.5 particles were found to cause lung damage and harmful changes in blood vessels and clotting .

Switzerland tops the list of countries ravaged by war and extreme poverty . It measures a country's population by factors contributing to its citizens' contentment . Britons are happier now than they were two years ago, but still ranks in at a relatively lowly 21st place . The United States is a full 10 places below Canada, ranking at 10th and fifth . Unsurprisingly the world's least happy countries are places destroyed by war . Icelandic citizens are now so happy that they jumped from number nine in 2013 to number two this year .

The Martingale Betting Strategy originated in France and is used with levels of success by punters on ANZAC Day . The traditional game involves two coins but many venues now play with three for ease of betting among the crowd . 'A punter simply bets a stake to win an amount of money if they fail to win with the first bet they don't win,' says author Mike Steward .

Mahonia, which is also known as Oregon Mountain Grape, is a berry native to the Rocky Mountains that's been used by tribes for medicinal, food, and ceremonial needs for years . Mahonia has been used traditionally for skin itchiness, infections and irritations, and is highly recommended for acne . Researchers have published full DNA sequences of one mammoth found in Oimyakon, northeast Siberia - thought to be around 45,000 years old . The fossils were found on an Arctic island that seems to have become cut off from the mainland 4,500 years ago . But the researchers behind the genetic analysis have urged other scientists not to attempt this for fear of the suffering it may cause . Instead, they say their findings have revealed new insights into evolutionary history and demise of the woolly mammal .

North East city was followed by the City of London where 4.9 per cent people reported problems, and in Knowsley, Merseyside, 3.4 per cent were forced to call in exterminators . Southend, in Essex, is most pest free and residents of North Lanarkshire most likely to report problem .
Hormone replacement therapy increases a woman's risk of breast, womb and ovarian cancers, new study shows . Women's Health Initiative in US and Million Women Study in UK showed strong evidence of HRT . Those who use combined HRT for more than 10 years have doubled risk .

But despite his critics' negative reactions to the tattoo, the father says he doesn't regret his decision, even claiming that he would happily get it done again .

For some women, the test can accurately tell if the risk is as low as five per cent, which is as good as if not better than the odds for those who have chemotherapy . Most of the tests are available privately and cost about £2,500 .

Two-up is a century-old tradition that dates back to Australia's goldfields . The coin game was played in dawn services and memorial services to remember those who landed at Gallipoli in 1915 . Men and women were yelling 'heads' or 'tails' as coins were thrown in the air . It is considered a form of gambling and is illegal at all other times . Anzac Day is held every day by Returned Servicemen League clubs and pubs across Australia .

Energy it creates, using semi-conductors, can be shot back to earth . Dr Adrian Quarterman says the lasers will be able to fire at solar panels to boost the energy they are receiving . This combines with the existing 11-year solar cycle, causing even more powerful coronal mass ejections (CMEs) and solar flares that can endanger Earth .

A 7.8 magnitude earthquake could kill 10 to 30 per one million people in California, but has killed at least 1,900 in Nepal . Nepal is under constant threat of natural disaster, but experts claim its shoddy infrastructure and poor building standards make the country much less equipped to deal with the aftermath of major incidents .

Photographer Jeffrey Milstein has shot a fascinating project documenting black boxes, shedding light on what happens to them . Despite the name, the boxes are usually red to help rescuers spot them among the wreckage of crashed planes and helicopters . His work saw him gain access to air safety facilities where data recorders end up following an accident . After disaster strikes, there is an immediate attempt to cover the black box, as seen in recent tragedies such as Germanwings flight 4U 9525 .

The coastline of Shiretoko Peninsula near the town of Rausu, on Hokkaido Island, has risen as high as 50ft from the sea surface . Geologists believe the emergence is a result of a landslide nearby, when melting ice and snow caused a section of land to drop, pivoting the underwater area into the air . The mass measures roughly 1,000- 1,640ft long, and 100ft wide .

St Ivan Rilski Church is the only remaining evidence of the community of Zapalnya, Bulgaria, where residents lived until they were forced to leave their homes . Named after the patron saint of Bulgaria, the crumbling stone structure now cuts a ghostly figure in a few feet of water . Residents’ abandoned homes were inundated and destroyed when the settlement and surrounding area were submerged in 1965 .

Palaeontologists are referring to Chilesaurus diegosuarezi as a 'platypus' because of its bizarre combination of characteristics, including its small skull and feet . The animal is proving to be an evolutionary jigsaw puzzle because it belongs to the theropod group of dinosaurs - which includes the famous meat eaters Velociraptor, Carnotaurus and Tyrannosaurus .
German engineers describe the EOssc2 as an 'ultra flexible micro-car for mega cities' and plan on enabling it to drive itself . The concept car can turn on the spot, shrink in size and even move sideways, like a crab, so it can park itself. Currently, the two-seater vehicle can be driven in the traditional way, diagonally and sideways .

Nasa scientists in California have revealed an interactive 3D map for Vesta . The map lets you see features on the surface including craters, hills, mountains and even 'canyons' Using images from the Dawn spacecraft, you can also see how the sun changes at a location over time . You can also switch between three main views - over the North Pole, a Global view or looking down onto the South Pole . There’s also an option to 3D print an entire model of Vesta with a 3D printer .

University of Waterloo scientists have created a 3D master map of galaxy superclusters . Map represents regions with many galaxies shown in white or red whereas regions with fewer, dark blue regions marked in uniform blue . It will help astrophysicists understand how matter is distributed in the universe and provides key insights into dark matter – one of physics' greatest mysteries . The map spans nearly two billion light years from side to side .

The orchid is one of the most instantly recognisable flowers in the world . It has evolved a so-called lip - a large and irregular modified petal, to attract insects - but the driving force behind it was not known, until now . Researchers from National Chung Hsing University in Taiwan found that its shape is determined by two competing groups of proteins . They converted lips into petals in two orchid species by reducing the activity of the L complex using gene silencing .

Greystone Park Psychiatric Center, in New Jersey, was built to house hundreds of mentally ill patients, but it eventually was home to more than 7,500 patients . It has long been abandoned and has been left to fall into disarray, now known for its crumbling walls, flaking plaster and gaping holes in ceilings and staircases . Preservationists are battling to save the building and claim the building should be turned into a museum and housing .
WWF identified 11 'deforestation fronts' where 80 per cent of projected global forest losses by 2030 could occur . These are home to indigenous communities that depend on livelihoods and endangered species such as orangutans and tigers . But they are being lost to expanding agriculture, including livestock farming, palm oil plantations and soy production . Unsustainable logging and wood fuel collection is also causing forest degradation - while mining, construction of hydroelectric dams and other projects cause roads to be built .
The 511 elephant tusks, worth $6million (£4m), were seized upon arrival at a major port in Chonburi province in eastern Thailand . The ivory, hidden among tea leaf sacks, was shipped out of Kenya on March 24 and went through ports in Sri Lanka, Malaysia and Singapore . Thailand is one of the top destinations for African ivory smuggling in Asia and could face international sanctions soon .

17 miles (27km) long iceberg B-34 was born in the West Antarctica's Getz Ice Shelf . The monster berg, larger than Manhattan, was spotted floating freely by the U.S. National Ice Center NIC . Glaciers in the Amundsen Sea are losing ice faster than anywhere else on the continent and are the largest contributors to the rise of sea levels .
Kim Davies bought the Elizabethan manor in rural Wales where Cecil Frances Alexander wrote All Things Bright and Beautiful . But he then made dozens of illegal alterations including installing a whirlpool bath with shiny mosaic tiles, crystal chandeliers and spotlights in the ceiling . Davies initially denied five charges but pleaded guilty to illegally altering Llanwenarth House, near Abergavenny in Monmouthshire . The 60-year-old could face a prison sentence if found guilty .

First responders had to break through a second-floor window to enter the locked home in the Kensington section of Philadelphia . All four children were taken to St Christopher’s Hospital for Children and were found to be in good condition . Neighbors were stunned to learn of the allegations against the mother, whom they described as a hard-working airport employee and nursing student .

The $39.99 (£26) Nanoheat Wireless Heated Mug is fitted with a rchargeable battery, nanoheater and heat sleeve . It can maintain the temperature of hot drinks at 68°C and 71°C (160°F) for up to 45 minutes . The mug weighs a little over one pound (454g) and can be charged wirelessly or using a traditional USB cord .

Andrew Chan and Myruan Sukumaran will be blindfolded with a piece of fabric and face the firing squad at midnight on Tuesday . Australians will be led from their isolated cells in Batu prison through the wildly dense tropical forest on Nusakambangan Island in Java . The reenactment of the execution was aired on national TV the day before five foreign drug traffickers were killed in January .
Currently mobile phone companies charge customers up to 20p a minute to dial what are free numbers from a landline phone . Net result is that millions of people dialling what should be free services run by the NHS, the government and company call centres end up paying hefty charges . The charges will end from July 1 under proposals published by the telecoms watchdog, Ofcom, today .
Greg Hardy was forced to abandon his luxury Bentley in flash floods in Dallas . It took the tow truck several hours to successfully remove the car and he was later seen returning to collect some of his possessions . The problem with his car comes as more bad news for Hardy who was suspended by the NFL just days ago after domestic abuse allegations .
The 99.7 per cent accurate BioSure HIV Self Test enables people to test themselves when and where they like . An estimated 26,000 people in the UK have HIV but are unaware of it and may be transmitting the disease to others . Treatments available mean HIV is now a manageable disease – but late diagnosis can have devastating impact on health and life expectancy .

Apple sold more than 61 million iPhones in the quarter, accounting for more than two-thirds of its $58 billion in revenue for the quarter and the lion's share of its $13.6 billion in profit . As expected, the numbers were down from the previous quarter, when holiday shoppers snapped up a record 74 million of Apple's new iPhone 6, 6 Plus and older models . Revenue from Mac computers rose 2 percent from a year earlier, to $5.6 billion, while iPad revenue fell 29 percent . Apple didn't report any results for the new Apple Watch, which began selling
